alec.is.awesome.spaceinvaders

Class CanvasView

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • alec.is.awesome.spaceinvaders.CanvasView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.View.OnTouchListener

    public class CanvasView
extends android.view.View
implements android.view.View.OnTouchListener
    An Android custom view that can be drawn upon and receive touch events. This is similar to a JFrame except that the constructor is called by the operating system, not you.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • backgroundColour

        private int backgroundColour
        Background colour of the view. By default it is clear This can be modified here or in the Android colours resources file. res/values/colours.xml

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init(GameLoop g)
        This makes the gameloop aware of the CanvasView and vice versa
        Parameters:
        g - The gameloop that is in use for this game.

      • updateScreenSize

        private void updateScreenSize()
        Modifies the screen size (in case of screen rotation)

      • onTouch

        public boolean onTouch(android.view.View v,
                       android.view.MotionEvent event)
        Method that deals with input coming via the phone's touchscreen. Look at MotionEvent for more information. It is worth being aware of the fact that for multi-touch enabled devices the second touch is not an ACTION_DOWN event but rather a POINTER_DOWN event
        Specified by:
        onTouch in interface android.view.View.OnTouchListener
        Parameters:
        v - The view from which the touch event originated
        event - Information about the event eg. location of click
        Returns:
        True if this is the last view that should be aware of the event false otherwise

      • onDraw

        public void onDraw(android.graphics.Canvas c)
        This is the primary method called by the operating system to draw the View. This is the equivalent to paintComponent
        Overrides:
        onDraw in class android.view.View
        Parameters:
        c - The Canvas object that will be used to draw the game on.

      • drawBackground

        private void drawBackground(android.graphics.Canvas c)
        Helper method to draw the background which is transparent
        Parameters:
        c - The Canvas to be drawn upon

      • setGameState

        public void setGameState(int state)
        Allow the game loop to let the canvas know at what state the game is in.
        Parameters:
        state - The new game state to be set

      • drawCentredText

        private void drawCentredText(android.graphics.Canvas c,
                             java.lang.String toWrite,
                             int y)
        Helper method that writes text centered horizontally on the screen. Note \n will not work with is method
        Parameters:
        c - The canvas to draw on
        toWrite - The text to display
        y - The vertical location of the text.
